oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Special Raffle of Rare Book to Benefit AFA Conservation Fund
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: N/A, N/A
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Supporting the AFA Conservation Fund makes these projects possible:•Breeding Biology of the Bahama Amazon•Status and Conservations of the Cape Parrot in Southern Africa• Ecology, Breeding Biology and Conservation of the Yellowshouldered Amazon in Margarita, Venezuela= Study on the Impact of Hurricane Gilbert on Psittacine Populations in Mexico=The Genetics of the Puerto Rican Parrot•Status of the Hyacinth and Glaucous Macaw in Argentina and Paraguay=Natural History of El Oro Parakeet in Ecuador= Macaw Conservation in Belize and Honduras•Yellow-lored Parrot Conservation in MexicoAssist us in continuing this critically important work. Use the envelope included in the center of this magazine, fill out the tickets and enclose your check. All donations are tax deductible. A drawing will be conducted at the annual AFA Winter Regional Meeting, to be held President's Day weekend, 1991. You need not be present to win. Void where prohibited by Jaw. One ticket is $10.00 or all four tickets for $35.00.• See Watchbird. Vol. XV, No. 6, Dec/Jan 1989, page 47 for a review of this outstanding book.
